1123648281047781376.text: We need solutions that address security and #privacy for our data. Consumers are at the center of this.

1123644502529519617.text:
When it comes to data security, we need to make sure the things that happened in the 2016 campaign cycle don’t happen again in 2020.

The issue of information being stolen or manipulated to influence or disrupt governments shows that we’re vulnerable – and we need to do more.

1123640729111339010.text: The benefits of the online world are everywhere, and so must be the protection of personal information. We need to make sure the culture of monetizing personal data is countered with consumer protection. Congress has to come to terms with this.

1123636952845017088.text: We need to work with our international partners to form coalitions around #cybersecurity standards. We should work towards harmonizing privacy and cybersecurity regulations.

1123633178445524993.text: The internet is a global network. No matter how secure, our networks remain vulnerable to weaknesses abroad. It’s essential we have a national strategy to deal with #cybersecurity threats.

1123629402569338881.text: Consumers continue to be bombarded by privacy threats. Day by day, #cybersecurity adversaries become more sophisticated and organized. We need to take a more proactive approach to cybersecurity and make sure we’re continuing to protect consumers.

1123625629046329344.text: We must create a culture of data security that protects consumers and allows commerce to continue to grow.

1123621853640232960.text: It’s clear that companies have not adequately learned from past #dataprivacy failures. At the expense of consumers, we’re seeing that self-regulation is not sufficient. Consumer data continues to be mishandled.

1123618048760516610.text: When the dust settles after a data breach, consumers are the ones left harmed and disillusioned. It’s important we develop a federal data #privacy framework to protect consumers.

1119782806471598080.text: Today in Winthrop we’re celebrating the protection of more than 340,000 acres in the #MethowValley from the development of a large-scale copper mine. This landmark conservation achievement represents one of the largest mineral withdrawals in Washington state’s history.

1119767707472232449.text: Nearly 1 million people visit the #MethowValley every year, and recreation in the valley contributes more than $150 million annually to the Okanogan County economy. This place is special and we will protect it from mining. @MethowHeadwater

1119756105012453376.text: On the road to Winthrop today and I had to stop and enjoy the view. What a beautiful state we live in! 🏔 https://t.co/uqTLLE3PZy

1119752608300670976.text: Protecting the #MethowValley is important to the jobs, businesses, creatures, and people who depend on these lands. We've permanently withdrawn more than 340,000 acres of @ForestService land in the Methow from mineral development.

1119737509389299712.text: The Methow Valley is truly a special place. A copper mine in the heart of the valley would have threatened everything that makes this place a treasure. We passed the #Methow Headwaters Protection Act to put a stop to mining threats for good.

1119722408821137408.text: The Upper #Methow is essential to salmon recovery, and more than $100 million has been invested in restoration & conservation efforts in the #MethowValley alone. Last month, the president signed my legislation to protect critical streams, creeks, and wildlife in the valley.

1093181144823201799.text: Many underserved rural and Tribal areas in Washington still lack quality wireless and wireline #broadband service. We cannot leave these areas out of the economic opportunities provided by connectivity.

1093175423427579904.text: I believe the U.S. will continue to dominate the innovation economy. One of the best examples of this innovative spirit is the work going on in #SmartCities, and one of the best proving grounds for this technology can be found in Spokane.

1093171338099986440.text: If we roll up our sleeves and get serious about #cyber, I believe the United States will continue to dominate the innovation economy and win the race to #5G.

1093169543059517440.text: I’m calling on the @FCC to use its existing authority to help make sure #5G communications networks are safe and secure. Congress is watching.

1093168153994186752.text: I am calling on the Trump administration to finally get serious about #cybersecurity. It should provide all of us with a real, quantifiable #5G security threat assessment.

1093167853996527617.text: #5G promises interconnectivity on an unprecedented scale. These networks will be part of the bedrock of our innovation economy.

1093167351208521728.text: Innovators in Washington state & around the country are exploring how #5G will fuel the continued growth of our trillion dollar, 21st century innovation economy. This will help cement the U.S. role as a leader in the information economy.
